The chicken croquettes were quite tasty and served in a shoe for some reason. The pepper dishes were also quite good. We sat at the tapas bad and it was great fun to watch everything being made.

Solid high end tapas with a few standouts. I love Jamon Iberico and paired with the croqueta it is an amazing bite. We aslo enjoyed the Chicken and Rabbit paella, beet salad and Jamon Iberico sliders (a  must order). The paella can take a while so sit back and relax with some sangria and enjoy the food!
It's a great place, in Las Vegas. The choice was amazing, and the food was terrific! This is definitely a great place for a party. Thank you for an unforgettable evening!

Tapas, tapas, tapas with good service.   One "mulligan"... I like brussels sprout but here the salad was mediocre, oily, no flavor.   Spanish wine options are spectacular with [Vegas] reasonable mark-ups.

Food and service was superb! I dined here with a group of three during Las Vegas Restaurant week. The menu included 9 tapas courses and we ordered two gin and tonics, as well as sangria, and a glass of wine. 

The standout dishes were definitely the paella (which was vegetable, i can only imagine how amazing the seafood paella is!) the Melon con Jamon serrano (carved fresh!) and the sliders with Ib√©rico bacon.

The meal exceeded my expectations. I find sometimes when there is a special or pre-fixe menu the quality isn't as high, but this was definitely not the case. I have had tapas in Spain and this is the first restaurant in North America that the tapas has come to par with restaurants in Sevilla and Barcelona.

I have food allergies and our waiter was extremely attentive and separated my courses from the others in my group. He also suggested an amazing glass of wine to match the paella, and was extremely knowledgeable and more importantly nice.

Prices are a bit on the high side (our bill came to $270 for three including tip.) But the quality of food is totally worth it, I'll definitely be visiting again.

Having been to The Bazaar by Jose Andres and loved it, I was excited to try some of his more traditional fare.  Overall, I thought this meal was fun and an overall success.  We came here on a Sunday night without reservations but were seated right away as a table had just become available.  This is off to a good start!

We started with the Aceitunas ($12 for 4 anchovy stuffed green olives and 4 kalamata olive spheres made from sodium alginate).  I've had Jose's black olive spheres at the Bazaar and actually thought the kalamatas work much better.

Next, we had the Chistorra Envuelta ($8 for 6 skewers).  The spicy chorizo  was quite tasty and contrasted perfectly with the crunchiness of the potato chip wrapped around the  skewer.

The waitress highly recommended the Gambas al Ajillo ($10 for 6 shrimps) which the menu features as one of their most popular dishes.  Maybe it was high expectation from the waitress and the menu, but I thought the shrimp wasn't really anything special.  Sure it was perfectly cooked, but it just tasted like nicely cooked shrimp with garlic oil.

My favorite dish of the night was easily the Pinchon Estilo Alcantara which was squab topped with foie gras and shaved black truffle ($22).  All the flavors came together so well.. I would have ordered this plate just for myself.. who says sharing is caring?

The Rape a la Donostiarra ($10 for a large platter of thinly sliced monkfish) was pretty solid.  The waitress said it was a brave dish.. I've never had monkfish prepared this way before, but didn't think it was anything overly eccentric.

Finally, we had the Arroz a Banda con Bogavante ($28) which is their lobster paella.  I was really looking forward to this, since we were sitting right next to the paella station.  As a quick note, they only serve 2 paellas at any given night, and could take up to 30 minutes to prepare, so be aware that not all options are going to be available.  The paella was quite rich and tasty.. a tad over-seasoned, but that's ok.  Each dish is served with half a lobster tail and a claw, which was a nice touch.

We had our meal with a pitcher of red sangria, which I highly recommend.  You can never really go wrong with wine mixed with fruit.

Overall, Jaleo was pretty much what I expected from Jose Andres - tasty, modern Spanish cuisine.  I can't wait to come back to try everything else on the menu.  Definitely come in a group to maximize the selection.  I thought our party of 6 was perfect, since most of the dishes come in groups of 6.  Also, I actually thought the price was fairly reasonable for what we were getting.

4 stars!!

Located inside the Cosmopolitan.  I can't remember everything we ordered, but here are some things to definitely try:

- the dates
- the paellas - if you don't have preference of which one, just order whatever paellas is cooking in the middle of kitchen there
- the salmon tartare
- the taco cones
- and definitely try the cured ham

The ambiance is very modern and fun.  Get a seat at the big cushion-couch and enjoy your party!

Let me preface this by saying that Jaleo still has some kinks to work out, but it has 4 star potential.  If you're vegan, and don't feel like trekking to the Wynn, Jaleo has a ton of tasty vegan(izable) options for you.  I used to live in DC and go to the original Jaleo in my pregan days, so I was very excited to see Jose Andres open a restaurant here!

I went there solo and ate at the tapas bar, which is fun, because you get to watch them make all kinds of little dishes and you can ask the sous chefs about what they're making etc.  Plus the people next to me were very friendly and we had a nice chat.  The atmosphere seems very laid back and conducive to such interactions.  (Note: it's not like a sushi bar; they don't serve you directly.  A server will come up behind you and take your order.)

You would be well-advised to make a reservation if you want to eat there on a weekend night - it was completely packed with a line when I went.  I got the only seat left in the place!

Note: the food here is VERY salty because they use a lot of finishing salts.  If you aren't into that, just request your food with "no added salt."  I had the pan con tomate (tomato bread), espinacas (wilted spinach with apples and shallots), papas arrugas (salted roast potatoes with red and green chile sauces - not spicy though), and the chef brought out a sample of the veggie paella!  I also had apple sorbet for dessert.  (For Bay Area people - they use the same Pacojet technology as Scream Sorbet to make an amazingly creamy vegan sorbet).

Everything was very tasty, if a bit oily and salty.  Very rich!  (I will order w/ no added salt next time.)  The folks next to me shared their sangria, which was very tasty (although not made the traditional way... they add the fruit to your glass rather than macerating in the wine.)

The service was very attentive at times, but hit or miss.  I had a great time and enjoyed my meal and will definitely be back with a group so I can try lots more things!

For you non-vegan foodies, you might wanna check out e, the chef's tasting room at Jaleo.  They do a 20-course dinner (two seatings a night) for ~$150.  They can make exceptions for some dietary restrictions/allergies, but sadly don't do a vegan version (yet?). 

Here is a list of the vegetarian/vegan/veganizable dishes:

Pan con tomate -tomato bread
Gazpacho - cold tomato soup
Manzanas con hinojo y manchego (minus cheese) - apple-fennel salad
Espinacas a la Catalana - wilted spinach with sherry dressing and apples
Escalivada - cold roasted eggplant and pepper
Setas a ajillo - garlic mushrooms
Trigueros con romesco - asparagus w/ Romesco sauce
Ensalada de coles de bruselas con albaricoques, manzanas y jamon (minus the jamon - ham) - brussels sprout salad
Remolacha con citricos (minus the cheese) - citrus/beet salad
Papas Arrugas with mojo verde y rojo - roasted potatoes
Verdura Paella - Veggie paella (they do not use chicken stock, only water)

Was recommended by a friend and I'd give it 5 stars great service and awesome nearly sublime tapas!  We had the fresh gazpacho soup, smooth and packed with flavor, carne asada We ordered 3 more need I say anything else about that?  Fried shimp with lemon Aioli and a black salt that was amazing. The ham and chicken croquettes were very tasty but a bit  creamy for me.  We also had a sliced ham platter and it was great too!  Our server was Bryan who was friendly and attentive, they had food runners so no one waited for anything`.  I will definitely go back again!  
Only downside ..is that parking at the Cosmopolitan Hotel is a bit tricky, because of confusing signage and traffic control.   We were late so we valeted however even  going out we found it chaotic .  I felt like I was in a big city like Manhattan with horns blowing etc LOL  its almost as if they expected fewer drivers and more pedestrians or just vacationers!  All that said it was still very well worth it!

I'm not sure what's up with the poor reviews but my friends and I had an awesome Tapas' dinner here on 11/12/11. 

The restaurant was packed and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves as we were. It was loud, in fact there was a party of four next to us drinking sangria and getting pretty tipsy but we enjoyed it. It was fun and festive and there was plenty of people watching right there.   

Our waiter was fantastic and he recommended lots of wonderful dishes. 

We had...
Bacon Wrapped Dates
Flat Bread with Serrano Ham
Endive with Goat Cheese, Almonds and Orange
Prawns with Red Chiles 
Lobster Paella
Flan*** DO NOT MISS THE FLAN 
Olive Oil Ice Cream

My husband's favorite was the flat bread with the Serrano ham, my friends was the endive with goat cheese almonds and orange and mine was the flan and the olive oil ice cream. 

We are all familiar with Spanish food and therefore knew that the portions are on the smaller side and meant to be shared. 

We all came away extremely happy and looking forward to going again when we are next in Vegas.

If you are looking for a heavy meal that makes you want to sleep for a year, don't go here. This is the perfect place to start out a night on the town.

This place is great!!!!! Love love love it. Everything was amazing. The only thing we didn't care for was the tomato spread on the bread. Scrapped some of the tomato off and it was great. Mussels, apple salad, Spanish cheeses. Amazing. We went twice. I'd come back every time.

By far the best tapas we've had in Las Vegas. Our waiter was well versed on the menu which was helpful. We had the chorizo fried in potato, the scallops, the egg with caviar and the paella. People have complained about portion size, but tapas are small plates! This is the first restaurant we have been to where every bite was better than the last!

I won't lie, I'm surprised I'm giving this 1 star given the description of this place, i expected to give it 5 stars. Unfortunately I really have very little to say that's good here. 

Arrived for my 8:15 reservation @ 8:00pm and checked in. Was told I could wait at the bar and buy the $18 Gin & Tonic (apparently the best in Vegas) and they'd call me shortly. about 1.5 hrs later, I finally was seated. yes. 1.5 hrs... and given the reservation was for 8:15 I was pretty disappointed. Even more disappointed by the fact that I watched a walk-in that had arrived AFTER my group and was seated before us (there were a few open tables we conveniently stood by that the walk-in's got). There's no question, the hostess just forgot about us. it wasn't until the bartender noticed our annoyance that he went and got us a table. Strike 1.

I love (and I mean LOVE) tapas. We ordered a bunch of traditional dishes, expecting them to be a little more traditional. The patatas bravas (that were around $14) was a bowl of potato chips w/ mayo & spicy tomato sauce on top of them. yes. POTATO CHIPS. This was highly disappointing. Strike 2.

Service was incredibly slow - we ran out of water and waiting over 30 minutes trying to get a refill. WOW. Strike 3.

Out of the dishes we ordered, I couldn't point to a single one that was better than the food at Julian Serrano (in Aria, just next door). And of all the dishes we ordered, all were more expensive than their counterparts at Julian Serrano. None of it tasted bad, I just can't justify the price for the taste.

Finally, at the end of the meal, we all ended up forking over around $85/person and walked away still hungry. 

Will not be going back.

This place didn't live to its hype.  We went there Friday night and we're surprised they ran out of Paella except for the rabbit and chicken one and a pork one.  We ordered the pork along with the steak and the chicken fritters.  All 4 of us were extremely disappointed.  Why? The food was super salty, oily, overpriced and came in tiny portions.  We left hungry.  Also our waiter rushed us even tho the place was less than half full.  I don't recommend.

Myself and 7 friends had a late Saturday dinner at Jaleo restaurant in Las Vegas, excited to try their tasting with wine pairing menu.  Not only was the SERVICE TERRIBLE ( waiters did not know the basics such as introducing courses and effectively clearing table between courses -our table was completely cluttered with plates) but all my friends the following morning came down with FOOD POISONING.  Even during the meal, before we were ill, we did not enjoy the food.  We found the food to be very salty, oily, and stale -- NOT AUTHENTIC SPANISH CUISINE.

During our meal experience, there seemed to be confusion and miscommunication between the staff which was appalling considering the restaurant, at such a high price point, considers themselves as "fine dining." This was definitely NOT a fine dining experience. 

We called the restaurant manager the next morning to notify him of our experience and collective illness, and although Dillion was sympathetic and attempted to make amends, our time Saturday night and Sunday morning (some into Monday) in Las Vegas was completely lost.

So if you are ever in Las Vegas and looking to try a restaurant with delicious cuisine and phenomenal dining experience, look elsewhere. Jaleo is not the place for you.

This is such a unique dining experience, in a fun casual setting.  

The vegetarian paella is sooooo good!  Loaded with all sorts of fresh veggies, and usually loaded with mushrooms, which I adore!

The croquettas are served in a shoe! So fun!

The pan con tomate is so simple yet so delicious. 

The spinach salad is delightful and refreshing.

The secreto..omg next level! Don't pass this up!

The mini burgers, made from acorn fed pigs, also next level! A must!

The service is attentive and friendly and it is a fun atmosphere.

This is a great place for groups and it is a great place to bring tourists because it is so unique.

Jaleo was terrific. Great atmosphere in the heart of The Cosmopolitan's foodie scene.  The center of the restaurant is a $2 million grill/open flame where they grill meats & veggies and make a mean paella!

We started with a bottle of cava (of course) and went on to enjoy several tapas for the table. We especially loved the verduras asadas, patatas bravas, paella (pork), and the gambas.  The only dish we did not love was the jamon iberico fermin which was a bit fatty and lacking in flavor. (However, the aged ham in the verduras was amazing)

Really fun dining experience!
Such a fun experience! Went with a group of 8, we all got to order a bunch of small plates to share. Great atmosphere and service! Highly recommend if you are going to a show at the Cosmo. A+

I'm sorry, but I was very disappointed.  Although the decor and atmosphere was very nice, the food was mediocre at best.  Tapas portions ranged from minuscule to fair.  It just screamed of tourist trap dining.  We went to firefly (inadvertently) the next night and the difference was unbelievable.  If you are in the mood for tapas, do yourself a favor and skip Jaleo.

To sum it up in two words: Undeservingly pretentious.  The food was so overpriced for what it was.  Tapas with very fancy names and descriptions that are mediocre taste and presentation.  A carafe of sangria is $50 and it's maybe 1/10th as good as the sangria from Firefly. 

We ordered a variety of items to share between a group of 6 people.  This included Vieiras Con Salsa De Romesco (scallops), pork and foie gras canelones with bechamel sauce, grilled skirt steak with piquillo pepper confit.  

The scallops were 2 tiny little scallops that were presented in such a dismal way that would never have made it past Gordon Ramsay in the show "Hell's Kitchen" (you know, where the scallop station is the death of every contestant!).  They were tiny and drowing in this orange sauce.  

The pork and foie gras canelones were probably the best out of all the things we ordered.  No one could detect the foie gras though.  They looked and tasted like little enchiladas so if there was foie gras, it was minced into the pork inside the canelones.  

We didn't eat all that much, but our bill was about $900 for the six of us.  If the food had been spectacular, I would have said it was completely worth it, but the food wasn't even "great."  What a waste, but I guess that's the risk you take for wanting to try a different fancy restaurant.  Just because it looks and seems fancy certainly does not guarantee a great culinary experience.

Last but not least, the service was all over the place.  Yes the restaurant was very busy, but our servers acted like they were running around with their heads cut off.  For a fine dining restaurant and that price tag, I expected more.

Just stopped in for some drinks and appetizers. Cant even tell you what we ate, but I can tell you it was all good. We just asked our server to bring us four different apps. They were all fantastic. I'll have to go back and read the menu some time.

Loved this place! I visited a Saturday at 9:00pm and the place was full. We were seated without much wait and received fast service. The menu is extensive and there is something for everyone to enjoy. I ordered the salmon (VERY tasty and plenty!), a cheese plate (blue cheese, honey and nuts) and the bacalao which is a cod fritter. 

From all of these, I liked the salmon the most. I thought it was a good substantial portion. It is recommended to order 2-3 plates per person. The portions are small but the quality is high. 

I also ordered wine and my friend ordered a drink. The drink was delicious and the wine was good too. Next time though, I would order a cocktail because they were that good! I wouldn't come to this place if you are someone that likes to get stuffed with food. I prefer smaller and tastier options that big plates. 

Will be back again for sure!

Having lived in Barcelona, I was pleasantly surprised to find pan con tomate like I used to have in Catalunya.  Everything was authentic and well made and I was happy that tapas stayed tapas as it should.  It's a bit on the pricey and hipster side to be honest but the food was solid.

The food was tremendously bad. The service was ok. 

I ordered the bread topped with tomato. That was literally the only edible thing that got to my table.

The really overpriced anchovies or sardines or whatever they were came alone- just olive oil and salt in the shape of fish. Not impressed. 

I also had some kind of a cold almond milk soup that tasted vinegary. It made no sense to me why anyone would eat that. I took one spoon-full and called it a day with that monstrosity. 

Next was the worst thing I've ever had- mushrooms with some kind of potato puree. It tasted like they took dirty socks and boiled them with potatoes. It was literally inedible. I took a small taste and that was it. It smelled like gym shoes. It just defied logic. 

What is this place? 

Lastly some paella. It was ..ok.. the fish was dried out and hard. There was enough rice to  nibble on to at least get the taste of the other garbage out of my mouth. 

I would highly recommend going here with someone you hate.

Came here during our bachelorette weekend o' fun. Was a little sad they didn't do anything to make the bride feel special. At one point the guy clearing dishes dropped a fork right on my friend's head. I think it fell tine side down because she was in pain for a little while. Also unimpressed that they didn't do anything to make up for that. But the food here is good. And some of it is super delicious. 

Ca√±a de cabra con higos - Amazing. Super delicious. Order it.
Patatas Bravas - Also quite tasty. This was by far the best 'bang for your buck' of the plates we got.
Chorizo casero con pur√© de patatas al aceite de oliva - The potato had better flavors than the chorizo. I don't know if that speaks to how amazing the potato puree was or if the chorizo was a little tame.
Gambas al ajillo - I don't eat shrimp, but my friends said the sauce that came with this was some of the tastiest of the meal. They were sad to not have bread or something to soak up the rest of it.
I'm realizing as I look at the menu that they brought me the wrong tuna. No wonder I was disappointed. I thought someone must have eaten the goat cheese before it got to me, but no. I never even got what I wanted. :/ Anyway, I ordered Ensalada de mojama con ca√±a de cabra, but I got Atun con ajonjoli y piquillos confitados instead. It was okay, nothing special. 
Endibias con queso de cabra y naranjas - Fine, but I would suggest trying one of the other verduras options. I feel like the apple and fennel would be a more interesting one to try next time.
Paella Valenciana 'Rafael Vidal' - Good. I'm not super familiar with paella so I can't speak to how it compares to others, but I would order this again.

One of the restaurants by Jose Andres', inside the Cosmopolitan. 

We tried several dishes and they were hit and miss. I liked salmon tartar in a cone and seafood croquettes. Fried ham n cheese (forgot the name) and toasted squid ink pasta were meh.... And I love anything squid ink. 

The best thing was the olive oil ice cream w/ grapefruit sorbet I had for dessert. Rich olive oil flavored ice cream paired with the sorbet was just out of the world. I could've had two. Or four. 

Service was excellent.

My wife and I had dinner here a day after eating at China Poblano.

We loved the overall ambiance of the restaurant. It was modern and fun without being stuffy and serious. We had about 6 tapas including the lobster paella. Everything was tasty especially the chicken fritters, garlic shrimp, squid, and paella. 

We liked how they showcased the traditional paella kitchen with gigantic paella pans and wood burning pit.  We can't wait to try all the other tapas...maybe they will open another Jaleo in L.A.?

Tapas, tapas, tapas and more tapas I stuffed myself. What a great selection of tapas. You could injure yourself trying to eat all these great small dishes.

The servers where spot and very knowledgeable. The runners were prompt to remove spent dishes.

If you have any question on what to get and you will the menu is complex the servers will guide you through this wonderland of Spanish gastronomy.

All the dishes were yummy. We had the Butifarra, Carne Asade con Escabeche, Calamari with squid ink and the flan for dessert. The dishes were really great except the Calamari. Our server was very friendly, food came out fast. Love the ambiance.

I'm surprised at the low ratings here, as my husband and I found Jaleo to be delightfully delicious after ordering a decent sampling of different dishes. 

We came in a little early, around 4:30 so the place wasn't hopping quite yet for dinner. After our flight and check-in to our hotel, and then getting over to the Cosmopolitan, (which is beautiful by the way) we were ready to eat. We used Open Table for our reservation, as we weren't sure what to expect. They're on the conference floor of the Cosmopolitan, and the restaurant is big and open. I wasn't expecting such an open and airy space. They had high tables in the main space, as well as a space off to the right with I believe a mix of lower and higher tables, as well as high bar seating, and then actual bar seating along the wall of the main space. At the back of the main space was a huge open kitchen with a fire pit where they make their paellas and that was so cool to watch. 

We both ordered teas, although their drinks looked amazing. The menu is so big and comprehensive with big descriptions that it takes a little while to pick out a small handful of items to order, especially if  you're trying to coordinate with another person. Our waitress, Morgan, was more than accommodating as we read our novel menus and picked out our tapas. We decided on the following: 

Lomo Bellota: We started with the Smoke-cured, acorn-fed pork loin. It was thinly sliced, nicely presented and had a lot of great flavors, we enjoyed it. 

Gambas al Ajillo: This was my husband's choice - shrimp in a garlic sauce. It was actually a tomato garlic sauce, and came with a cute, miniature piece of baguette, he liked it.

Paella de Pollo: The chicken and wild mushroom paella was by far our favorite dish of the evening. While filling, and a decent portion, we ate the whole thing. It was flavorful, buttery, and just incredible. The best thing we had, hands down. 

Piquillos Tolosa: These were thinly sliced red peppers with sauce - they were fantastic. Soft, yet firm enough to pick up with a fork. They weren't spicy at all, and had a subtle sweet flavor. These were our second favorite of all that we ordered.

Coliflor: This was roasted cauliflower with green olives and dates. We weren't crazy about this dish, and felt it was an odd combination. The sweet with the cauliflower and the tang of the olives was a little too bizarre for us.

Atun con Ajonjol: My husband ended with the sesame crusted seared tuna and said that the tuna was over seared and tasted a little old, but over all the dish was ok.

I'm giving Jaleo four stars. We really liked the tapas experience and the restaurant was clean and pretty. Our waitress was super attentive and really nice, and took the time to explain everything to us. The paella is worth two stars on its own, we loved it so much. I'm leaving off that last star due to the Coliflor and the Atun con Ajonjol that could have been better, and we felt that everything was a little pricey. Otherwise though, this was a stellar experience that has us thinking about doing tapas again. Thanks!
The food was served almost cold and one plate at a time. The waitress forgot our last plate that was an empanada we realized 30 min passed and cancelled the order. Not a favorite here won't be back!!

We went to Jaleo in Vegas at the Cosmopolitan and I loved it! I have always been a fan of tapas and we had just got to Vegas and wanted a quick snack...We had : Gambas al ajillo (shrimp and garlic in a sherry sauce, Jamon Iberico (cured ham),Salchichas (Sausage), and Chorizo... And they were ridiculously out of this world. You cannot go to a Spanish Tapas place without trying the jamon and the shrimp.The food was on point. It was everything a person needs from a Spanish Tapas bar; trendy look, Jose Andres playing on tv, you see the cooks getting the open flames ready and slicing meat, the smells permeating from the kitchen- it was everything!
The overall experience was pretty laid back. We sat at the bar just to take in the full experience. Our bartender was attentive and made some good recommendations for the drinks (anything with tequila). I would recommend it to anyone!

Great service and excellent food. We had our server pick out the entire meal and he did a fantastic job. We started with endives with mandarin almonds and something else I can't remember. We had croquettes serve in a shoe...they were amazing but the show was weird...apparently the chef trying to be cute....but kind of tacky but I guess that flys here in sin city.  We also got shrimp, steak and bruschetta which were all equally amazing but our favorite was the carne asada steak. The dessert was the French toast and was awesome. I would recommend jaleo to even my most picky foodie friends . Again the service was so good it rivaled the best in NYC.
Trendy.... but really bad service and the food is just alright. Super over priced - typical Vegas, I guess. You'll probably leave hungry.

the ambiance is really nice and the service is AMAZING, but the food however is just ok. i tried a lot of different things but I can't say anything was absolutely amazing it was just "ok". that said, the service was very nice and friendly. during the busy dinner time, i noticed not that many people were there at all. empty restaurants usually are a good sign of mediocre food. the sad thing is i really hate to give it such a low star rating because everyone there was so friendly but for the food prices and small portions, i just would not recommend this place for food. it's one of these places where im sure the way things are prepared is very intricate and has a lot of infused this and that in it, but once you get the actual food, you're thinking..."um am i missing something because this is not the most amazing thing i have tasted in my life. in fact its just "food" but nothing really amazing"

I found this place to be pretty mediocre. I was with a group of 5.  Our waitress kept telling us that we EACH needed to order at least 5 tapas or we would be hungry.  Um...no.  We ordered about 12 total for the table and that was more than enough, but good for her to try and drive the bigger sale. The paella was the star, but everything else was just ok.  Had some tomato bread with serrano ham, the grilled shrimp, and oysters were decent.  The chicken fritters were gross and didn't care for the chorizo either. Service was only so-so - very aggressive waitress and slow drink service.

I went with some coworkers after work for drinks and dinner. I have to say I was surprised at the rating. Now that I have dined here I understand the 3 star rating. It's the service. I hate to say it but it sucks! If I order a bottle of wine the least you could do is open the bottle , serve me a glass and refill it as needed. The food is actually very good and the ambiance is nice but I wouldn't come back. There's tons of other restaurants in Cosmo with more attentive servers.

Tapas style restaurant by Jose Andres. Had a great experience from reservations and hostess (Bri and Crystal) to my knowledgable and friendly server Francesca who guided me through a large menu.  

- Jamon Iberico bellota Fermin was melt in your mouth good, paired well with the pan con tomato and selection of cheeses
-Grilled asparagus in Romanescu(?) sauce was tremendous, wanted a jar of sauce to go
-Lobster salad with grapefruit was a nice bright middle course
- seared scallops with the same romanescu sauce were delicate and tasty
- seared squid in squid ink was my least favorite, but still spot on

The food tastes good but it's insanely tiny for the price! Look, I'm totally cool with spending a lot of money on food, but only if it's worth it! This place acts like they are one of those super fancy restaurants, but it's really just too trendy for its own good. You can tell by the look on the waiters' faces that they know you're about to get ripped off. After you get the bill you have to convince yourself it was worth it so you don't feel like a sucker. That's why this place has so many good reviews. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

I've had quite a few amazing tapas experiences in my day so Jaleo really had big shoes to fill in terms of leaving me wowed.  I did enjoy the open concept floor plan so we were able to see all the chefs hard at work.  However, the weird bull thing hanging on the wall was just that, weird.  Then there was the picture of the sleeping woman on the other wall.  I guess I felt like the decor didn't make any sense (I'm not an interior decorator so take it with a grain of salt), it was just a bunch of random stuff put here and there.  Perhaps I would have been more into the decor if the rest of the experience had been more impressive.

Anyway, the food was not terrible by any means.  The chicken fritters (served in a shoe, WTF?) and the "huevo fritto con caviar" were both quite memorable and delicious.  Lucky me, my hubby is allergic to fish so I was able to enjoy, or should I say devour, the egg/caviar dish on my own.  The rest of the items we ordered ranged from ok to good.  I guess where I was really let down was the high price of everything compared to the lack of wow factor.  Don't get me wrong, I'm fully aware Vegas can be very pricey but if I'm going to pay top price I want a top notch experience.  Given that we ate at my favorite tapas restaurant in Vegas the very next evening, got twice the amount of food and liquor, and still paid about 1/3 of what we paid at Jaleo, I can't give them any higher than 3 stars.  Also, since we had such an amazing experience at a few of the bars on the first level of Cosmopolitan,  I was expecting more from Jaleo.

Jaleo was so amazing!!!! I absolutely loved the shrimp paella, the sheep milk with the toast, and the shrimp in some tomato sauce. Mario Luna was our waiter and he gave us superb service and attention! He also recommended this awesome gin and tonic with juniper and this cool spherical ice cube that was inside it. Overall, the restaurant is simply beautiful and elegant and the food was amazing! I will be back
Mediocre food and perfunctory service. Sadly disappointing for a birthday dinner.  Had the tasting menu and wine pairing. Better off at Momofuku or, better yet, Chica at the Venetian.

I have NEVER sent a dish back to the kitchen before but had to at Jaleo. The waitress told us they were out of the lobster paella. We ordered other tapas but 5 minutes later she came back and said "Great news!. We have one more batch of lobster paella we can cook!" Great but... paella takes 45 mintues to cook (she let us know that when we sat down) and it arrived to our table 5 minutes later. Really??? I tried one bite and it was obvious that the paella had been sitting out for awhile under a heat lamp. Proably becuase antoher customer hed already refused it. The food was cold, the plate was cold, and the rice was well-done. I didn't dare try the rubbery lobster. The dishes we ordered afterwards were fine but nothing special. If you want great tapas in Las Vegas, go to Firefly on Paradise where I've always had great experiences with both food and service~!

For those who do not understand what GOOD FOOD IS,,, should not make reviews! This restaurant is totally LEGIT! Hands down AH-MA-ZING!
We made our reservations on open table..
Made sure our Paella Negra and Mushroom and Chicken Paella were ready when wet got here. We were pleasantly greeted,  led to our table, 
Our server suggested 3 extremely delicious appetizers.. the Endives, the bruschettas with roasted tomatoes all over it and the shrimp gambas. I also got their non- alcoholic Shirley temple while my husband settled for their house Spanish red wine.  Wow! That Endive was out of this world! A fusion of flavors! You would not expect,  orange,  goat cheese,  toasted pumpkin seeds if I'm not mistaken,  sprouts would go well together... like ratatouillie.. Lol. 
The toast with roasted tomatoes.. another explosion of flavors in your mouth! .. And the gambas... will take you to a whole new place..
This place is an experience of tiny tapas.
Brace yourself for three paellas..
When the paella Negra was served,  it came with a chunk of tender octopus.. it was good but I think a squirt of lemon would make it a perfection. 
They gave me a tasting of their house paella made of chicken and mushroom.  That was pretty good too. We ended our dinner with their flan.  I am biased since I make the best flan.  But the sorbet was outstanding.  If you're in Vegas,  don't you dare miss trying out this place! Or you'll regret It!

4 stars for their food... otherwise it'd be 2 for service.

Came here with a large group and were seated "outside" (but not really outside).  We ordered many apps to share, such as the fritters served in a shoe (yup), warm endive with goat cheese and pine nuts (something like that... maybe I'm just making it up), warm brussel sprout salad, salmon carpaccio (yum), fried egg topped with caviar (boring, actually, and there was too much egg to caviar ratio that the caviar got lost), and my favorite... the uni toast... omg!  Smokey flavor galore.  Make sure you order that!

Now for service: I asked him for his preference between the salmon carpaccio and the salmon/ikura tartare cones.  He salad he preferred the tartare, but I still went with the carpaccio.  He then proceeds to argue with me saying that the carpaccio vinaigrette overpowers the salmon.  Even after I told him I appreciated his suggestion, he kept going and going and going, almost offended that I went with the opposite.  Chill out, you're not the one eating it.  And guess what, the vinaigrette was not overpowering at all, in my opinion.

We have been looking for a good Spanish Restaurant that serve Tapas, and fortunately we found it , the cheese, cured ham, eggplant was wonderful. For main course we ordered the roast pork, this one didn't meet our expectation, when the manager asked if everything was ok, we said yes but the pork, and when we got our bill , we were surprised that they took it off the check, great service!
Another restaurant in the cosmopolitan that is overrated and overpriced! 100.00 per person and we left hungry. tiny portions and less than special paella!

I came here with a party of 4. Our waitress was nice and friendly. The food is above average but I didn't think it was amazing. I like the presentation of their plates. I recommend the chicken croquettes. We ended up ordering another for our table. I would come back but there are some other restaurants around Vegas that I'd like try first.

Dear Jose Andres,

Please stop making such delicious food. My bank account hurts.

Jaleo has one of the largest menus I've ever seen. Factor in my inability to settle on just a few items, I will get just about everything that peaks my interest... Which unfortunately for me is everything on this massive menu T__T The food here is fabulous. It's not just delicious but creative, innovative and exciting!

Jaleo has a 5-star selection of cured meats. I personally like to start my meal with these items. I consider the embutidos to be the money-waster section of the menu. Portion sizes are small. Zero bang for your buck but oh so totally worth it. If you're feeling frisky, opt for the kobe of pork products. You only get like 5-6 slices but the cured ham from the magical unicorn pig from the isles of... gotcha! In all seriousness, get the black-footed Iberico just once. It's supposedly fed only acorns and results in meat that makes your mouth water just looking at it.

Vegetable-wise, Jaleo makes an amazing warm brussel sprouts salad with apricots, apple and serrano ham. They only use the outer leaves and they're cooked to perfection so they still have a bit of bite. Its a good enough portion for 2 but you'll want the whole bowl to yourself. Also noteworthy is their sauteed spinach. And where else can you get Liquid Olives? These little suckers are a result of some sweet molecular gastronomy. Little blobs of deliciousness that emulsify on the  palate. Sounds weird but I swear they're amazing. They're served with 'real' olives too. I'm a beet addict and always looking for new ways to prepare them. Their Beet Salad prep is 1. different from every place else (no generic roasted beets with goat cheese) and #2 has pistachios in it--the junk food of nuts.

Some of my favorite fried items include the Bacon-Wrapped Dates (nothing special but still delicious), the fried eggplant, and the Cod Empanadas (they're served with honey which makes these totally addicting!)

Seafood: Gambas al Ajillo (shrimp & garlic) and the Squid w/ Squid Ink. If you're craving mussels, order them elsewhere. The ones here are pretty uninspired.

This review is getting a little lengthy so I'll just finish the food stuff by saying the carne asada needs to be ordered. :)

How much you spend is entirely dependent on how much food it takes to satiate your appetite and how much meat you order in comparison to the potatoes.  I mean that literally and figuratively. We generally spend $50-80 per person when we come here. Most dishes run $10-20 but of course there are the outliers (like the ham and paella). And drinks are pretty pricy here too. When you have that WTF moment when you see Jose's $17 gin & tonic... trust me and Jose when we say it is THE BEST gin & tonic you will ever have in your life. Juniper Berries are the business. Plus, be endlessly entertained by the ice sphere (which I like to obsess over every time).

If your server's name is Mario, run for the hills.

I consider myself to be somewhat of a Jos√© Andr√©s fangirl so I was naturally looking forward to dining at Jaleo.  Needless to say, my expectations were not met.  The food itself was decent.  Not quite as inventive as The Bazaar's offerings but with the lower price point, that's to be somewhat expected.  Service, however, was horrifically below a restaurant of Jaleo's caliber.

When my party was seated, the waiter proceeded to give us the "key dishes you should try" shtick including the many varieties of paella that the establishment is famous for.  Okay sold.  We try to order the paella only to be told that we can't do so because we have a party of four and the menu states that you must have a party of six or more.  Uh, okay.  Then why did you just spend all that time raving about your paella?  We then ask if it would be at all possible to check if there were any other tables ordering any of the paellas that we could combine ordering forces with because we really wanted to try the paella.  Our waiter flat out rejects us without even bothering to check.  Now I understand that there's a certain protocol to be followed and I wasn't necessarily expecting an exception but would it have been so hard to double-check (pretending to check would have been more than sufficient)?  Oh and here's the delightfully irking kicker: OUR SERVER WAS WRONG.  While dining at √© by jos√© andr√©s this past weekend, the infinitely more gracious and knowledgeable waitstaff notified me that every night, Jaleo makes a paella of the day for the entire restaurant to order individual portions from; the six or more limit only applies to parties who want to order a paella of their choice.  A waiter who's clueless about the menu at an upscale(ish) restaurant?  For shame.

Following the paella debacle, I excused myself from the table so I could surreptitiously notify our waiter that one of the girls in my party was celebrating a birthday and that I'd like to surprise her with a dessert.  I couldn't find the waiter so I told the busboy who had been helping our table who in turn said he would pass along the message to our waiter.  While giving us our dessert menus, our waiter proceeds to ruin the surprise by saying, "and are we celebrating a birthday today?"  I wouldn't expect this kind of a misstep from a T.G.I. Fridays let alone Jaleo.

Had service been passable, I would have rated Jaleo at a solid 3.5 stars.  Were it not been for my wonderful experience at √© by jos√© andr√©s this past weekend, I would not have even considered returning.

Had the tasting and wine pairing menu and it was delicious! Just the right amount of food. The tomato bread, fritters, and the iberico with figs were the stars. The paella was good, but I think because they are known for it we expected it to be amazing and were a bit underwhelmed. Wine pairings were good, but wish there was another one or two more unique varieties.

The food is incredible. This is our fourth time here. We just cannot stop eating. We had Pan Cristal con tomate, endibias, shrimp, paella....and Sangria. 
It was perfection! Love this place

Paella de pollo y setas silvestres was very flavorful, it was the best paella I had so far. The rice was well seasoned and perfectly cooked. Lomo Ib√©rico de bellota Ferm√≠n is also very delicious. Can't wait to go back for more.

Love the food and the service is great!

AWESOME.

Great service.

Really good menu selections.

We had a fantastic time and would strongly recommend it to anyone looking for a great dinner spot.

GET THE MINI BURGERS...

And the fig jam cheese...

We've been to Jaleo in DC before, so we had really high expectations. Food and cocktails were still good, but it just wasn't as good as the other location. Rather than spreading out our tapas so that the table didn't get full, we had multiple tapas brought out at once. It felt more rushed. I ordered a $20 speciality gin and tonic (the citrico) that tasted about like a happy hour well g&t. The arbol-infused margarita was much better tasting and more interesting. The meat platter is about the only thing we got that was amazing, though the other items were pretty good (anchovies, tomato bread, sea urchin toast, stuffed peppers, smoked iberico ham crudo).

Wow this place was absolutely amazing! All the food just melted in your mouth to perfection! I was super impressed. One place with great service great drinks AND superb food?? Yes, they had it all!

I would definitely recommend this place for good drinks and snacks...(I say snacks because the portions are all smaller then appetizer size) but totally worth it.

It was fun it was a very social place and I might hit this place before I go clubbing from now on ;)

Ok dishes... The tiniest portion size (and yes I know tapas... that wasn't even a sample!) and service was nil.  I've never felt so ignored and neglected at a restaurant in my life... We brought a group of 9 people with us... so it's not like it was the largest party either... It wasn't that busy considering it was a Thursday night and on top of that when someone orders sangria for 4 people, that means only 4 will want it... so please don't bring cups and enough for all 9 guests and charge us for 9 when only 4 was specified... We even gave you 5 cups back

Went for a casual dinner and loved the atmosphere.  We had a reservation and waited about 5 min for our table.  There is a good buzz in the restaurant.  All of the food we had was very good.  We started with a cheese plate, pain tomate, and a couple other things.  The tomato bread is always a standout at tapas restaurants, and it did not disappoint!  I like that they have their drink menu on their ipad, but our waitress knew nothing about any of the wines.  She was the only detractor from our experience.  She was extremely disinterested and had no personality.  She wasn't really up for making any recommendations and never really smiled or bantered with us at all.  We also had the garlic shrimp, which was just so so, the sauce was a little weird, and also the asparagus, which was amazing.  You only get 4 small stalks so order more if you like asparagus and more than one person is eating it!  Would go back, would just hope for a different server next time.

Salty Salty Salty. 

I've been to Barcelona, Madrid and Valencia, and one thing you cannot go wrong in Spain is Tapas. I've been to the Jamon joints and couldnt believe how good the food was...

So hearing this place had tapas and had a renowned chef...me and my gf decided to go to this place and test it out. It was free meal on a Cosmopolitan invite, so we said why not.

First to start the wine was great, and spanish wine always gets me in the food mood. Second we placed our order for several tapas.

While in Spain we loved the Patatas Bravas...and boy we were excited... Wuah Wuah Wuah... not only was it a liberal version of Patatas Bravas - it was salty...and it was pretty much like Potatoe Chips covered in Bravas sauce. MAN How the F can you get this wrong...its a standard in any Spanish Tapas joint...

Well to say the least it went downhill from there. I felt like each tapas I ate I was eating a salt cube. Yeah it was that bad, so bad that when we left Vegas I felt like I was on a salt binge. Whats worse is that the Jamon that we had was supposed to be good...man the cheaper ones in Spain blew this piece of ham out of the water. Yes we bought some from Corte Ingles in Barcelona and brought them home and they were better than this $17 plate.

Well to say it...we won't be going back....sorry it just failed miserably.

Was only in Vegas for 3 1/2 days but ate here twice it was that good.  And got the same thing both times, too!  We started with the tomato bread (it's not called that but that's what it is) and it was so good we ordered a second round.  Also got the nicoise salad (also not called that but that's what it is) which was perfect.  Add a 1/2 carafe of sangria and you will be happy.  Not cheap though and the space doesn't feel at all authentic to me, but then again I'm not sure what they were going for here.

I would give Jaleo 3 1/2 stars. The food was good overall. Must of the items that we ordered were good but only a few were outstanding - piquillo peppers stuffed with goat cheese and the paella were particular stand outs. This is a tapas restaurant so the portions are small but quite pricey. This is good if you want to try a lot of different things. I didn't like that the number of servings for each dish was variable and the server didn't mention this when we ordered. We had 4 people. Piquillo peppers included 2 servings, other items ranged between 2 to 5 servings. The atmosphere is energetic and bright.

This place is pretty high on my sh*t list. The food was delicious but the service was SHOCKINGLY bad. The waiter forgot to bring two of our dishes. When I got sick of waiting and pointed it out to him, he was like "umm, and which dishes might those be?" Really, you don't even know? Even after we informed him, it took forever to get the food - and it was just sauteed mushrooms and spanish omelette. We didn't get out of dinner until after midnight - the entire restaurant was empty! No apologies or anything. It was our last night in Vegas and I was hoping to spend a relaxing evening with my husband. Instead I got to sit around a stupid restaurant waiting for food. You guys seriously need to get your sh*t together.

We had a great experience at Jaleo!! The cheese selection and the tomato bread was outstanding! The meat, paella, and the sides were incredible! The service was impeccable! I will definitely be back.
One of the best service by Aubrey!!!

I'm not a huge fan of tapas, but this was an exquisite meal and a fantastic experience. The food was delicious and the service was top notch. I would most definitely recommend to a friend and I will be returning next time I'm in Vegas.

Gin and tonic. Is it fair to base an entire review upon one drink, perhaps not, but that is all I really remember. We were guided here by a newly made friend who told us they have the most amazing gin and tonic. This proclamation did not do much to impress me because really, what can be so impressive about a gin and tonic? But, I was dumb. The gin and tonic here is a thing of beauty. The taste is so refreshing and awesome in the purest sense of "I was awed". 

We had some nibbles too, and those were good, but everything paled in comparison to this simple drink done so well. I must go back and try it again soon. Maybe tonight.

I have been to more than one location of Jaleo and they are all top-notch.  From the food to the service everything is great.  Order about six little plates for two. The tapas style dining allows you to try several different things without getting super full.  This location also has an open kitchen with paella cooked over a flaming fire.

Such an interesting food experience. The Iberico and the cheeses are the most amazing may to start. The cocktails were perfectly crafted and well presented. (the cuba libre is the best you'll ever have, and the sangria is very good). All the tapas were fantastic, but dont forget the wonderful meat dishes to finish. The ribeye and the lamb are remarkable!! I unfortunately  can not remember our servers name, but she was fantastic! Thank you Jaleo for a wonderful experience.
FUKN ROCKSTAR!!!!  JOSE you have done it again! Love the food the service was elite as well!!!  DEFINATE MUST

Randomly ended up here as me and my co-workers were looking for a quick bite before heading into Marquee. While a bit pricey for any tapas that I have been to, what do you expect? You're in The Cosmopolitan. My review is off only a few items so I will definitely be back to sample a few more things to see whether or not it goes down or not I had the bruschetta prosciutto and a cocktail (I forget the name) which had vodka, wine, blueberries, cucumber water, and some type of red syrup. The cocktail was really good, maybe too good. Was there any alcohol in there? I'm not sure but for reason I would order it again. I have had better bruschetta but what was really good was the one bite I had off of my co-worker's dish, veal cheeks. The meat with the puree just melted in your mouth. In a way, it reminded me of one of my favorite lunchtime dishes in elementary school, shredded turkey and mash potatoes, but in a more sophisticated way? While a little on the expensive side, I would be willing to come back next time I'm staying in hotel to try out some more of their items.

Spanish Cheese Selection.
Iberico Fermin Selection & Jamon Iberico de Bellota Fermin.
Grilled Bread with Tomato.
Ensalada Verde.
Gazpacho.
*Paella del Dia w/ Chicken & Mushrooms.
*Olive Oil Ice Cream w/ Grapefruit.

LOVED the last two items. E'rythang else was OK.
Jaleo is nice and the food was pretty good. I think the tapas portion here us much smaller than usual. It's also really pricey. We spent 50 bucks a piece for 3 tapas and 2 drinks.

The fried dates appetizer alone will get me back here. I am in love with the Jaleo Bramble signature drink (I had 3 or 4). Also, the flan with the orange sorbet is out of this world. Besides the fact that they gave away our table for 8 (then made us wait 30+ min for a table I had reserved over a month in advance) after I asked them to hold it for 10 minutes while we got our wrists stamped for Marquee Nightclub upstairs, we had a wonderful experience.

Pretty good, really small portions but i guess thats the point. The champagne was good, served in this glass with fresh fruit. 
I came with a group of fifteen girls so thats probably why the portions turned out so small. Everything was pretty good and uniquely served (one dish was served in a shoe!).
Overpriced so probably wouldnt come back.

I returned and it got that 5th star. One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas and I love eating and sharing. The desserts did it, man. the best flan I've ever had, some olive oil ice cream and a chocolate dessert that kind of shut my talkative ass up for a minute. 

Had the Paellea, it was good but not as good as I had in Spain. I actually enjoyed the fideo-type dish (paella with noodles instead of rice). the aioli makes it really good though.

Omg... Get the tasting menu. For $75 you get like 12-13 plates and they are legit! So full of flavor, quality and beauty. Our servers were all really nice and the runners (?) were so good about clearing our tables promptly. Our fave dishes were the veggie paella, gin oysters, watermelon tinged gazpacho, nectarines with anchovies, and the dessert.
The service seemed a lil confused at times. For instance we got our hangar steak plate after our dessert. So we just packed it up to go. Not sure when we're going to eat it tho BC we're so full. 
Seriously it's a great deal considering how much each of these plates individually are. Get it!
Oh and the sangria was really really good too! Cava cleared palate really well too for next plate. :)

I ate here with a friend of mine, we thought we would try something different. First thing is the place is loud and very open when you first walk by but once you get in there to be seated  you are crammed in there. You can basically reach over the someone else's table and grab their food literally...LOL it was a  weekend night.
 The service was impeccable, the food being tapas is obviously small portions but very delicious. I would go there again for the price and the taste but I would make sure I go on a weekday night.

There is overpriced. Then there are places like Ruth's Chris. Then there is Jaleo, which is in a category by itself.

I realize that Vegas is not cheap. But $2.50 for a slice of bread, a $14 appetizer which had exactly 8 anchovy stuffed olives, or a $49 pitcher of sangria that filled 4.5 small glasses is excessive. 

Everything put on the table was tasty but amazingly small. Waitstaff had a distant attitude. No normal person could possibly have be filled by less than 5-7 of the $10-$15 tapas.

Do not go here on an empty stomach or without cash or you might have to go down to the Pawn Stars shop to pawn your watch to pay your tab at Jaleo.

Even thou it's a bit pricy but it's definitely worth it. Just don't go there if you're hungry or else you'll be ordering 10 different dishes just like what the two of us did. The food is amazing and was so tasty. Will definitely go back there again when I stay at the Cosmo next time again.

Great food. Great tasting menu with wine pairing also available. 
Cool open concept. Jose Andreas is the Shiite. 

I'll be back!

Jaleo is a restaurant that is made for Vegas. Located in the Cosmo hotel, it's upbeat, generally packed and very creative from a food standpoint. If this review were based on creativity, this would be five stars. 

Sat for dinner on a Tuesday night and the place was rocking. I was with a few people so we ordered a series of dishes. I had some bruschetta, croquettes and a chicken dish. The bruschetta was surprisingly delicious and more filing at than usual due to the large pieces of bread. The chicken dish was called Pollo al Agillo, which was a chicken leg and thigh served with a balsamic glaze of some sort. It was pretty good, but nothing to write home about. 

The real standout of the meal were the croquettes. As I sat at the table I saw the waiter walking over to me with a sneaker in his hand... I'm like, you wanna hit the basketball court or something? But no, the sneaker contained a bunch of freshly cooked croquettes. Mind Blown... The croquettes were actually just ok, but the presentation alone was pretty amazing.

In summary, this is a really cool place to dine when in Vegas. Food is ok, but atmosphere is awesome. And that sneaker though!

I had dinner here with friends because of the paella of course and to try the most delicious gin and tonic.  The meals are tapas and an experience. 

Our table wanted to try the Ribs paella but it turns out they only serve 2 of their 7 paellas each day.  We ended up ordering the chicken and rabbit paella.  It was okay..not much flavor.  

I also ordered the Tuna Cone which is three bites of goodness and the mini burgers are a must.

Best meal in Vegas during our 3-day trip. Lucky we ran into a guy at Blackjack who recommended it. Lost a star because our lobster salad was a little salty but otherwise outstanding. Don't miss the bacalao (cod) fritters with the honey aoili. I know, sounds crazy. But truly fantastic.

Located inside the Cosmopolitan Hotel, Jaleo was fancy, modern and acquired a very cute ambiance! LOVE LOVE LOVE! So many dishes to choose from and each was prepped and presented differently. Quite the dining experience. Sangria was AMAZING to go along with our Lamb, mushrooms, Sea Urchin, Fried Bacon stuffed Dates, Hangar steak and so much more I can't remember. 

Definitely a epicurean dining experience. Great place to eat pre-party! 
Excited to go back!!!!!

Me & my husband dined here because we were a fan of Jose Andr√©s. And I must say I will come here again to try some of their foods. For appetizer, I ordered the "Gambas Al Ajillo. It's a very buttery, garlicky shrimp served in a small pan alongside with a bread, almost look like a french bread, but smaller. Taste of the shrimp was phenomenal! Very tasty, oily in a good way. There was some kick to it. At first, I didn't like the bread coz it was too hard to bite, but our server (very knowledgable) told me that I should try to deep the bread onto the sauce so the bread wont be that hard to eat. I love it! Then, I ordered "Presca Iberica Crudo Ahumado" oh boy, I tell you. The slices of meat with its oOh so creamy sauce was very tasty and when I was eating it, I felt some of kind of orgasmic/sexy feeling like you would eat your favorite chocolate on a midnight craving sort of thing. Addicting to eat! Very rich in flavor. Sauce was fantastic, it got some tanginess that balances the salty side of the meat. I will definitely recommend this fine dining resto to my family & friends. Truly, Jose Andres & his amazing chefs put some love & thought to what they are serving to people. Very bold flavors of foods.

This was in our hotel (Cosmopolitan) Very "open" atmosphere, great for people watching. Loved the open kitchen setup so you could watch them cooking (in a very non-traditional way??) I don't eat pork or seafood, so there were very few things on the menu I could order. My friend had the bacon wrapped figs (which she said were delicious!) and I had the chicken in garlic sauce (very good!!) Now keep in mind, these are tapa style, so you're paying $15-$20 for a VERY small plate (mine was nothing but chicken, maybe 5 little slices??) great if you have a large party and everyone is sharing, but not good if you're on a date and want to order a "meal". Wish they had more chicken or beef on the menu, but I would come back again.
Food was delicious. Veggie Paella was amazing. So many options on the menu... Can't wait to go back and try more!

Glorious group spot in Vegas. I've been here twice and both times were amazing.

Pro's include beautiful people watching, very sharable food, and the best Hendricks & Cucumber I've had to date. It comes with a really neat circular cube and very fresh garnishing.

This worked out perfectly both Friday's we went before going out. Great rally-spot.

Our reservation wasn't until 6:45pm but after a helicopter ride to Grand Canyon, we were famished so, we asked the hostess if we could get a table much earlier.  After 10 minutes of waiting in front of the empty restaurant, we finally got seated.  This is why I'm only giving Jaleo 4 stars.

Our table was right next to the kitchen and I loved it.  I watched the chefs prepare food, slice the Iberico ham and brush tomato on rustic bread.  We ordered a lot of tapas (pan de tomato with Serrano ham, sambas al ajillo, pollo al ajillo con crema de queso, salmon crudo, bacon-wrapped dates, carne asada, mini pepito de Iberico) and they were all delicious.  The tapas came quick but the desserts (manzanas Carlota, pan con chocolate and pastel de chocolate y avellanas) took a long time.

The seats are great.  It was like sitting on and being surrounded by purses.  It's a pretty place.

My sister has been to Spain and she brought home some Spanish goodies and she has learned to make some tapas.  I can say that whatever she brought home and has cooked are pretty comparable to what we had at Jaleo.  I'll be taking a trip to Spain in a couple of months then come back to Jaleo when I'm having Spanish tapas withdrawals.
I just love the atmosphere, the service, and outstanding food. Have been coming for about 4 years now and won't miss having dinner here

What else can you say about perfect paella?  These guys never disappoint but the biggest hit with my group (Lip Smacking foodie tours) and my favorite app was the olives two ways, it fires off like a gel.

My fourth time there and I'll be back again

Jaleo. Is. Awesome. 

The hostess - super helpful in showing us the gluten free menu for Ryan and taking our reservation for later that evening.  Recognized us when we came back that night and promptly led us to our table. 

The atmosphere - a bit noisy but it fits for Vegas.  The restaurant is in a cluster of all the restaurants at the Cosmopolitan and it's open to the lobby/gathering area.  It's a bit quirky and modern.  There's a foose ball table to sit at if you'd like although the stools looked uncomfortable for the meal.  Just a neat looking place.

The service - spot on.  In a tapas restaurant sometimes things get lost in the mix since new dishes are coming out constantly, but not here.  Our waiter showed up right after we got settled and handed me the drink menu (in the form of an iPad which you can then order your drink on. Neat!)  Their staff is constantly refilling half empty water glasses, clearing the latest empty tapas plate and doing it all without getting in your way.

The food - The menu has a lot on it which is typical for tapas.  Since it was just the two of us we didn't try paella although I'd love to go back and get it.  We had just gotten back from Spain a few weeks prior so we wanted to see how their Jamon Iberico was and it did not disappoint, granted we got the most expensive one - Jamon Iberico de bellota Fermin which for 22 dollars is something you can fit in the palm of your hand.  But it's good!  Other favorite dishes:  the warm brussel sprout salad with apricots, apples and serrano ham which I found a similar recipe for online and it's almost as good.  Can't figure out what I'm missing.  Ensalata rusa which is proclaimed to be the ultimate spanish tapa and includes potato, mayo and tuna in a way I could never recreate.  We had other dishes and all were good but those were the stars.  For dessert, something everyone should try in their life.  Olive oil ice cream with grapefruit three ways.  This ice cream was the creamiest, most delicious ice cream and when you paired it with the tart grapefruit...unreal.  Try it.  Seriously.

Overall just a fantastic experience.  It was definitely expensive but we were in the Cosmopolitan on the Vegas strip...it's to be expected.  Go and enjoy!

Great atmosphere and wonderful food. Really enjoyed the bu√±uelos de bacalao with honey sauce. The bread that came with the cheese plate was very good and different than standard cheese plate bread--deliciously thin and crusty. They had an interesting take on patatas bravas, presenting it with the sauce on top instead of incorporated throughout. We enjoyed them.

We will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas and will keep an eye out for other Jos√© Andr√©s restaurants.

Came here with a girlfriend and had the best time. 
The space of this restaurant is great. You're not closed in and it sits among other great restaurants but you also don't feel exposed as since it open the rest of the floor. 
We did a tasting menu. AND IT WAS FABULOUS. 
One after another we were just blown away by ingenuity and flavour, flavour ,flavour. 
I was also sipping on the Mediterranean Gin and Tonic which was soooooo good. 
We spent nearly 4 hours at the restaurant 
We ended with the Flan. I would go back just for the flan. 
Hoping to return for our birthdays and experience √©.

My husband and I came here to have a drink and try their hams out.

Service was slow, we had to look for our server every time when we tried to order something, ask for water or ask question about the menu, etc. 

We ordered two glass of cabinet, a regular plate of their ham selection and plus one order of their hand-carved, dry-cured ham aged 3-4 years that was $35 per oz. The lady who hand cut for us gave us a plate of fat! We barely saw any meat, 50% was just fat; we were somewhat disappointed. Although it was very great ham, it was not worth the price for the amount of actual meat we got. 

Will not recommend and will not be coming back.

Good food, but plan on eating a hot dog later. It was very expensive for the portion size.  However, everything tasted amazing!  We had 2 to 3 tapas per person and each tapa had maybe 3 to 4 bites each and cost between nine and $12.   The cocktails were some of the best we had on our trip.   If you are in the mood to spend $20 on a gin and tonic I highly recommend their signature one.  This is definitely a splurge meal and I would recommend the restaurant just be prepared that the portions are a little bit on the small side.

I went to Jaleo in the Cosmopolitan with a bachelorette party full of girls with fairly different tastes and palates.  But our tastes were able to converge and Jaleo was a universal hit on food and flavor.

The dishes I remember ordering included pan con tomate, tortilla de patatas, vieras con romesco (scallops), bacalao fritters, eggplant and honey, croquetas, and lobster paella.  I know we got more but I think it's probably telling that I don't recall the other dishes.  While I have always wanted to go to a Jose Andres place and I love tapas, I feel like tapas are so commonplace that I really wasn't sure how this place could surprise.  But I was wrong.  Some of the flavor combinations truly were unique, surprisingly, and foodgasm delicious.  The standouts were the bacalao fritters and lobster paella.  The sweetness of the honey mixed with the cod was delicate, comforting and unusual in the most delightful way.  And the lobster paella made me want to lick the plate clean.  It had perfectly balanced seasonings, juicy perfectly cooked lobster meat, and was just spectacular.  Everyone was vying for more paella.  

Ultimately we were all extremely pleased with the quality of the food and how affordable our bill came out to be.  The only notes that marred the experience were the overly sweet sangria (not worth getting) and our waitress who had a little bit of an attitude and could have been far more attentive.  But the food is more than worth a visit.  Now I'm dying to try the Jaleo in DC and see if it compares!
The food was really good!! I enjoyed everything we got some a touch more then others but over all very good! Would definitely go back

We went there a few months ago, and it am still thinking about the food.  The endive salad with nuts and mandarin orange is so simple but busting with freshness and flavor.  I'm trying to look up for the recipe to make it myself.  The iberico pork was great.  The sliders were very good and crunchy.  The atmosphere was hip and for young 20-30.  The service was slow and not as attentive as I would like to see.  

Overall, it was still a great experience and I would recommend it.

Amazing, awesome, spectacular. Had such an epic meal last night at jaleo. I've been to many tapas restaurants all over, including in Spain and this has been the best so far in the states. Everything is imported from Spain and you can really taste the difference. The portions are just right- I didn't leave too stuffed or hungry... Just really good, clean tapas. The service was outstanding, really blew me away how detailed they are. Our server Travis was great- relaxed, but attentive, personable and provided good recommendations along the dinner. Thank you for an awesome birthday dinner, will definitely be retuning!!

Jaleo is a restaurant by Chef Jos√© Andr√©s' which is a modern Spanish tapas joint inside The Cosmopolitan Hotel Casino here in Las Vegas. It's a cool hip spot to be if you feel like some good food in small portions, i.e. tapas!  Let me just say wow. They deserve more recognition than they are getting absolutely five stars. There aren't many tapas places around and most are pretty average. Jaleo on the other hand is not average it is way above average. It really is that good. If you love Spanish food that is very traditional from Spain you will love this place. Some of the things you must try are the Pan de cristal con tomate which is amazing. They import the bread from Spain and cook it to absolute perfection with toasted slices of uniquely crispy ethereal Spanish bread brushed with fresh smashed tomato and garlic. Next is the Chistorra Envuelta en Patata Frita which is Slightly spicy Chorizo link wrapped in a Crispy Potato Chip with Membrillo Alioli. WOW seriously one of the best things on the menu. Next was the Gambas al Ajillo that is a famous tapa of shrimp saut√©ed with garlic. It's another amazing delicious dish. 
Lastly I would like to tell you about the goat cheese dish. It's called the Ca√±a de Cabra Con Higos. It's a soft, semi-sweet goats milk cheese paired with raisin walnut bread and fig jam. Another delicious dish!
What can I say except I think it's the best Spanish food in Vegas.

On a random Saturday night in May we decided to meet some friends for tapas on the strip. This place is pretty good. It is also super popular! We arrived at 8pm and left around 1 and there was still a line to get in. 

We basically tried one of everything and it was all good. I really enjoyed the bread with tomato on it and some chicken. My favorite was the sangria! It had mint in it which was a different touch that I will be adding to my sangria now!

My girlfriends and I recently took a trip to Vegas and dined at Jaleo one night.  They gave us this fun, private room which was nice to be away from the shopping-mall feel of the rest of the restaurant.

I thought the cocktails were good and the service was quite nice.  However, the food left a lot to be desired.  Everything was incredibly salty and nothing was a stand-out.  My friends and all I agreed that we could not even decide on what the "best" dish was because none of them were all that great.  The ham was pretty good as was the paella - though they only make two different kinds per night and the seafood one was not being made.  I think one of the salads was pretty all right too.

Overall, we ordered a lot of food and the price did not seem all that crazy (for Vegas) so in terms of convenience and service, this is not a bad choice...there are just so many other's in Vegas it would be hard to recommend Jaleo.

Best spot in the Cosmo. I tried China Pablano before and was impressed by Jose Andres. It was on the salty side for me, but I thought the food was good. A year later, a friend invited me out to Jaleo. Now this is where the celebrity chef shines. 

The wait because of Magic was ridiculous. Even with a reservation, we waited half an hour at the bar before our table was ready. That will not be a problem, because we were at the bar. Jose Andres restaurants are known for one drink and that drink is the best gin and tonic ever. This beverage has converted many who swear to not be gin drinkers. It is just that good. 

Once we got out table, it was an ordering frenzy. I will not even be able to name all of the items that hit our table, because we were flooded from the time the cava punch bowl was set down until it was time for desserts.

The highlights were the chilled garlic and almond soup, grilled octopus, iberico pork risotto, rack of lamb, and any dessert with the olive oil ice cream. By the end of our meal, we were ready to be rolled out of the restaurant. Self control was not even an option.

Why do I have to be on my diet coming here?! Unfortunately, my diet does not allow for paella, the dish that Jaleo boasts, but after having such a wonderful first experience, I know I'll definitely try it on my return. Food was excellent, tasty and creative.  Service was super fast, as in lightning fast! It seemed as if our orders came out within 5 minutes from ordering! At one time I asked for cream for my coffee and in what seemed like 2 seconds, suprise! The bus boy came right behind me with a little cup of cream! The menu, although shorter than Firefly's or Julian Serrano's, has masterfully crafted dishes.  My husband and I enjoyed every single dish we ordered. The wine list is well organized and well thought out.  Jaleo is the first restaurant that I have ever been to that uses Apple iPads as a menu -very unique and "trendsetty".  This is a promising restaurant and I can't wait to go back.

This was a good experience but not a great one.  I've been to a few of Jose Andres joints and this one was the most mediocre I'm sorry to say.  It is located inside the Cosmo and the place was hoppin but they put our group of 10 at a table outside of the restaurant which takes away from the experience.  It seemed like they had tables that were setup in the hallways because they were outside and removed.  If we are paying over 1k for food and alcohol, I want the whole experience.  The food was good but I liked my experiences better at the Bazaar in Beverly Hills and the tapas were a few notches higher to be honest.  The wait staff was just ok also.  I did like the food and I still love Jose Andres restaurants but I will not likely be returning here but am glad I got to try it out.

Our experience at Jaleo was just OK. Unfortunately, this location is not as good as others we have tried. My expectations were so much higher having dined at the Bethesda location. Unfortunately, the food was lukewarm and was prepared in advance, instead of being freshly made. 

In particular, I was disappointed by the paella. The best thing about paella is that it comes steaming hot in a paella pot, with the rice sticking to the pot having a very distinct flavor. It even says on the menu that the waiting time is up to 45 minutes, but our paella came very quickly because it was already cooked in a bigger pot, and it tasted like it was reheated. Our waiter explained that it can be made to order only for parties of 6 or more, so if you are a smaller party it will not be as good. 

Overall, our dining experience was good, but based on my experience at Jaleo in Bethesda I was disappointed because I was expecting so much more.

Dined here last Friday 5/4/18 and we were disappointed. First dish soup made with crab meat, raisins and almonds was spectacular, but then it went down hill. Dates wrapped in bacon was nothing special and were overcooked. Shrimp and lobster fritters had very little shrimp and lobster. Mostly tasted cheese. Braised rabbit was too chewy and not very flavorful. We sent it back with our plates and silverware because we didn't want the last dish which was hanger steak to touch it. The steak was good but again, nothing special. During all this time, the waiter never came by to ask how the meal was. Overall, the soup and the wine was very good.

If you are looking for something lively, light, and trendy, give Jaleo a try.  It is located in the Cosmopolitan Hotel and Casino on the Strip in Vegas.   The level with the restaraunts is all open to a common area with so it has an open feel.  It is rather load and a lot of movement between wait staff and servers, etc.  Tapas menu with prices ranging from $9 - $22 per plate.  We went for a light snack - ordered only 2 tapas but they accidently brought us a 3rd one: 

They waitress recommended about 3 tapas per person.  We only went with one since we had a very late lunch that day and really didn't want a full dinner.

Items sampled: Huevo frito con caviar - A fried organic egg topped with caviar over carmelized onion  $16 - which they slice and mix up at table) - it was served with crouton like toast.... I wouldn't have ordered it and the flavors were pretty mild.) We also had the Ostra Gin and tonic - Six oysters with lemon, gin and tonic $12 and the Vieiras con salsa de romesco (Seared scallops with romesco sauce) $10 -both of these items were tasty but nothing to go gaga over.

There is a private group room but other than than, would not say it's great for a big group due to the noise and you are seated really tight..

We love Jose Andres so we tend to find his joints everywhere we go. Luckily for us, we had so many of his places to choose from in Vegas.
